meanings.definition: To divide or distribute by lot
meanings.sent1: The teacher lotted the candies among the students.
meanings.sent2: They lotted the tasks evenly among the team members.
meanings.sent3: The siblings lotted the chores by drawing straws.
meanings.sent4: The captain lotted the playing time fairly among the team.
meanings.sent5: She lotted the prizes for the raffle with care.

meanings.definition: To assign or distribute by chance
meanings.sent1: The store lotted out free samples to customers.
meanings.sent2: The lottery lotted the winning numbers randomly.
meanings.sent3: He lotted the movie tickets by throwing darts at a board.
meanings.sent4: The system lotted the seats for the event without bias.
meanings.sent5: The computer program lotted the tasks based on luck.

meanings.sent1: The group lotted to determine the order of presentations.

meanings.sent3: The friends lotted to see who would pay for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The committee lotted to select the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The team lotted to decide the theme for the party.
